intro: Haplanthus tener, commonly known as the slender haplanthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This species is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
